title: Intermediate English 304
headline: Master vocabulary related to university life and use perfect modal verbs in this free online English course.
description: This course introduces you to the basic vocabulary related to university life, which will help you identify people and places on a college campus and different fields of study. You will revisit the present perfect tense and learn to use 'since' and 'for' with this tense. You will also review common modals and understand how to form perfect modals by combining modal verbs with the present perfect tense. Enroll in this course today!
courseDescription:
This course aims to introduce you to vocabulary related to life at university, with a particular focus on identifying people and places on a university campus. You will then become more familiar with the terminology and definitions of selected university degrees and learn how to use these new terms and phrases in other topics discussed in this course.

Once you have mastered the vocabulary, the focus shifts to two key grammar points; firstly, using the present perfect tense in various forms while exploring how to use 'since' and 'for' in this particular tense. Then, the second grammar section will help you discover how to use perfect modals to show regret, judgment, possibility, ability, and certainty and draw conclusions.

Finally, in the student practice section, you will observe and complete activities to enhance your English reading comprehension, listening, and speaking skills. In addition, you will find a downloadable writing task in this course's 'Resources' section that will guide you in improving your writing skills. Feel confident to speak English in various situations by registering for this fun and practical English course on Alison today!
